title: Combined Effects of Time Spent in Physical Activity, Sedentary Behaviors and Sleep on Obesity and Cardio-Metabolic Health Markers: A Novel Compositional Data Analysis Approach.
Sleep_Detection_Method: "How much sleep do you actually get at night on weekdays or workdays" as integer from 1 to 24 hours
Cutpoint_Type: Standard count per minutes thresholds (Freedson et al, 1998)
Closure_Method: Sleep (self-report) and accelerometer-derived SB, LIPA, MVPA expressed as proportions of 24 h and normalized so the sum = 1
Outcome_Variable: BMI; waist circumference; systolic blood pressure; diastolic blood pressure; HDL; LDL; triglycerides; CRP; plasma glucose; plasma insulin; HOMA
Covariates: Age; Sex; Race/ethnicity; Marital status; Education; Work status; Ratio of family income to poverty level; Smoking status; Alcohol consumption; Caffeine intake; Total energy intake; Saturated fat intake; Self-reported health (SF-12); Previous diagnosis of cancer; Previous diagnosis of diabetes; Previous diagnosis of cardiovascular disease; Previous diagnosis of stroke; Current use of diabetic medication; Current use of antihypertensive medication; Current use of lipidemic medication
Stratified_Analyses: BMI; Waist circumference; Blood pressure; HDL; LDL; Triglycerides; Plasma glucose; Plasma insulin; HOMA categories
Sensitivity_Analyses: Removed 10% of cases at random to test stability of model estimates
Notes: Check S2 file for more details about normalization and closure to 1

title: Associations between sleep duration, sedentary time, physical activity, and health indicators among Canadian children and youth using compositional analyses.
Data Source: Canadian Health Measures Survey (CHMS) cycles 1 to 3
NonWear_Criterion: ³60 consecutive minutes of zero counts, with allowance for 2 min of counts between zero and 100
Sleep_Detection_Method: Self-reported (response to "How many hours do you (your child) usually spend sleeping in a 24-hour period, excluding time spent resting.")
Cutpoint_Type: Count per minutes thresholds (Colley et al. 2010)
Outcome_Variable: zBMI; Waist circumference; Blood pressure; Behavioural strengths and difficulties; Aerobic fitness; Triglycerides; High-density lipoprotein cholesterol; C-reactive protein; Insulin
Stratified_Analyses: BMI z-score groups; All other health indicators stratified by quartiles
Bootstrap: Used to estimate standard errors and coefficients of variation to account for survey design effects)

title: Fitness, fatness and the reallocation of time between children's daily movement behaviours: an analysis of compositional data.
NonWear_Criterion: Standard deviation and value range of each accelerometer axis, calculated for moving windows of 60 min with 15 min increments
NonWear_Handling: Replaced by the mean value calculated from measurement on other days at the same time of day

title: Fitness, fatness and the reallocation of time between children's daily movement behaviours: an analysis of compositional data.
NonWear_Criterion: Standard deviation and value range of each accelerometer axis, calculated for moving windows of 60 min with 15 min increments
NonWear_Handling: Replaced by the mean value calculated from measurement on other days at the same time of day

title: Fitness, fatness and the reallocation of time between children's daily movement behaviours: an analysis of compositional data.
NonWear_Criterion: Standard deviation and value range of each accelerometer axis, calculated for moving windows of 60 min with 15 min increments
NonWear_Handling: Replaced by the mean value calculated from measurement on other days at the same time of day

title: Fitness, fatness and the reallocation of time between children's daily movement behaviours: an analysis of compositional data.
NonWear_Criterion: Standard deviation and value range of each accelerometer axis, calculated for moving windows of 60 min with 15 min increments
NonWear_Handling: Replaced by the mean value calculated from measurement on other days at the same time of day
Covariates: Sex; Age; IMD decile (Neighbourhood-level socio-economic status)

title: Adiposity and the isotemporal substitution of physical activity, sedentary time and sleep among school-aged children: a compositional data analysis approach.
Data Source: International Study of Childhood Obesity, Lifestyle and the Environment (ISCOLE)
NonWear_Criterion: ³20 consecutive minutes of 0 activity counts
Covariates: Highest education level of either parent; Number of parents in the home; Number of siblings in the home
Main_Findings: Reallocating time from MVPA to other behaviors unfavorably impacts body fat%; the compositional model is preferred over the traditional model as its estimates correctly account for the asymmetry, non-linearity, and starting activity composition of the child.
